intro: Oreocarya roosiorum, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its violet-blue flowers and hairy, basal leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. Oreocarya roosiorum is often found in open woodlands and meadows at high elevations.
